match.title: 5th ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 5 wickets (with 153 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 12.30 start, First Session 12.30-16.00, Interval 16.00-16.45, Second Session 16.45-20.15

headshotImage.caption: Ranjan Madugalle player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ranjan Madugalle player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza b Jubair Hossain 52 (54b 5x4 3x6 66m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: that's a googly and he's got Masakadza, the big wicket! It was flighted outside off, Masakadza drove with a big gap between bat and pad and the ball sneaked in through that

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda c Mashrafe Mortaza b Shakib Al Hasan 37 (51b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 72.54

dismissalComment.html: another one for Shakib and a very good catch from Mortaza! Sibanda went back for the short ball, pulled to midwicket where Mortaza dived to his right

strikes on his first ball when he's back! It was a flat delivery sliding in after pitching on off, came in with the angle and went past the bat to hit him in front of middle and leg, umpire says it's out. First ODI wicket for Taijul

one more, sneaks it through the gap! Panyangara stretched forward to defend the flighted delivery that didn't turn away but came in slightly with the angle and found the gap between bat and pad to hit the stumps. Kept a little low too
oh given lbw, one more for Taijul! It was flat and sliding in towards the stumps, the batsman went on the back foot but was hit right in front of the stumps and umpire gives it out

oh he's got it, he's got three in three on debut, the crowd erupts, Taijul leaps in joy! Chatara went down on a knee to slog the ball on the leg side, missed it completely and the ball angled in to the off stump
oh, Shakib has struck, Taylor is bowled! Shakib slid the ball in from outside off on length, Taylor pushed it outside off but missed the ball and it hit top of off stump
another one for Shakib and a very good catch from Mortaza! Sibanda went back for the short ball, pulled to midwicket where Mortaza dived to his right

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: that's it, the innings has been wrapped up! Kamungozi leaned forward for the delivery outside off, it turned away and bounced enough to get the shoulder of the bat to go to first slip for an easy catch

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 9 (14b 2x4 0x6 21m) SR: 64.28

dismissalComment.html: it's Mortaza who breaks the opening stand again! Raza chased the delivery outside off to run it down to third man but gave a simple catch to the keeper. It was short of length and shaping away further, Raza shuffled a bit towards off stump and poked to edge it to Mushfiqur

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza b Jubair Hossain 52 (54b 5x4 3x6 66m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: that's a googly and he's got Masakadza, the big wicket! It was flighted outside off, Masakadza drove with a big gap between bat and pad and the ball sneaked in through that

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor b Shakib Al Hasan 9 (11b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: oh, Shakib has struck, Taylor is bowled! Shakib slid the ball in from outside off on length, Taylor pushed it outside off but missed the ball and it hit top of off stump

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda c Mashrafe Mortaza b Shakib Al Hasan 37 (51b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 72.54

dismissalComment.html: another one for Shakib and a very good catch from Mortaza! Sibanda went back for the short ball, pulled to midwicket where Mortaza dived to his right

headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Timycen Maruma b Jubair Hossain 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: that's gone through, bowled'im! Maruma went on the back foot to defend it but it was a flipper which came in, it was flat and beat the bat which came down late to hit off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire lbw b Taijul Islam 9 (16b 0x4 1x6 22m) SR: 56.25

dismissalComment.html: strikes on his first ball when he's back! It was a flat delivery sliding in after pitching on off, came in with the angle and went past the bat to hit him in front of middle and leg, umpire says it's out. First ODI wicket for Taijul

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Taijul Islam 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: one more, sneaks it through the gap! Panyangara stretched forward to defend the flighted delivery that didn't turn away but came in slightly with the angle and found the gap between bat and pad to hit the stumps. Kept a little low too

dismissalText.commentary: John Nyumbu lbw b Taijul Islam 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: oh given lbw, one more for Taijul! It was flat and sliding in towards the stumps, the batsman went on the back foot but was hit right in front of the stumps and umpire gives it out

dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara b Taijul Islam 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh he's got it, he's got three in three on debut, the crowd erupts, Taijul leaps in joy! Chatara went down on a knee to slog the ball on the leg side, missed it completely and the ball angled in to the off stump

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.long: c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi c Mahmudullah b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (9b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: that's it, the innings has been wrapped up! Kamungozi leaned forward for the delivery outside off, it turned away and bounced enough to get the shoulder of the bat to go to first slip for an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 51 (55b 10x4 0x6 95m) SR: 92.72
Soumya Sarkar c Sikandar Raza b Chatara 20 (18b 4x4 0x6 30m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: the plan has worked! Sarkar jumps across outside off to try and tickle a short ball towards fine leg and forgets about Sikandar Raza who was lurking close-in. Chatara is overjoyed

and one of them comes into play! Anamul has been squared up and the edge is safely pouched. Oddly enough the ball was rather wide outside off, but the batsman had got into an awful position. His legs went leg side, his hands pushed at the ball and Masakadza happily converted the chance at first slip
the plan has worked! Sarkar jumps across outside off to try and tickle a short ball towards fine leg and forgets about Sikandar Raza who was lurking close-in. Chatara is overjoyed

caught down the leg side! It was a fuller ball and slanted down. Mushy goes for the leg glance but seems to have feathered an edge through. It's not quite clear. The umpires double-check on the front foot and it's all fine. Mushy though walked off with a shake of the head and a wry smile

wide delivery outside off and he finds third man, Tamim is gone! It was full and wide outside off, Tamim swished at it without much footwork with a drive and a leading edge flew down to third man for an easy catch

caught at first slip on the rebound! But before Shakib walks off, the umpire wants to take a second look at the front foot, which is completely fine. It was full and wide, teasing the batsman to play an extravagant drive. He had not covered the line, it was just his hands going at the ball and the thick edge is pouched rather well by Hami M

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Mire b Panyangara 10 (15b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: wide delivery outside off and he finds third man, Tamim is gone! It was full and wide outside off, Tamim swished at it without much footwork with a drive and a leading edge flew down to third man for an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Masakadza b Chatara 8 (13b 2x4 0x6 25m) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: and one of them comes into play! Anamul has been squared up and the edge is safely pouched. Oddly enough the ball was rather wide outside off, but the batsman had got into an awful position. His legs went leg side, his hands pushed at the ball and Masakadza happily converted the chance at first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Sikandar Raza b Chatara 20 (18b 4x4 0x6 30m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: the plan has worked! Sarkar jumps across outside off to try and tickle a short ball towards fine leg and forgets about Sikandar Raza who was lurking close-in. Chatara is overjoyed

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Masakadza b Panyangara 0 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: caught at first slip on the rebound! But before Shakib walks off, the umpire wants to take a second look at the front foot, which is completely fine. It was full and wide, teasing the batsman to play an extravagant drive. He had not covered the line, it was just his hands going at the ball and the thick edge is pouched rather well by Hami M

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Taylor b Chatara 11 (23b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 47.82

dismissalComment.html: caught down the leg side! It was a fuller ball and slanted down. Mushy goes for the leg glance but seems to have feathered an edge through. It's not quite clear. The umpires double-check on the front foot and it's all fine. Mushy though walked off with a shake of the head and a wry smile

commentTextItems.html: that's it. Mahmudullah gets to his fifty, Bangladesh have won the series 5-0. Length ball slogged away to the midwicket boundary to spark raucous celebrations in Mirpur

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all we have for you, thank you for your company and your comments. Good bye.

"Definitely, It's all been with us. We're very happy," Mashrafe Mortaza says. "First of all, Shakib, Tamim and Anamul, Mushfiq was the crisis man, Taijul was brilliant today and Arafat Sunny as well. They [backroom staff] kept working hard with us, giving us a lot of support and they have done a really good job."
Taijul Islam is the Man of the Match, for his hat-trick and finishing with 4-11 and collects a trophy from the Bangladesh prime minister.

Mushfiqur Rahim is the Man of the Series and he finally collects the trophy for winning the Tests 3-0. "Hard work for us this year, boys showed character and the batsmen did well. Shakib, Mominul and Mahmudullah batted really well and our bowlers did really well as well. Taijul and the spinners gave us the 20 wickets we needed. Couple of areas where we have really improved. and in the ODIs, Mash did a great job. Just happy to contribute to the team [even if I am not captain]"

"I dont think it was a good total, below par. Bowlers fought hard, it was a bit disappointing if you looked at the whole game," Elton Chigumbura says, "We've performend in patches and so we need to look at that, especially with the World Cup coming up. One or two guys are putting their hands up, but we need to correct our mistakes before going to the World Cup. Bowlers bowled well throughout the series and the Tests, they just need to carry on. Main thing is the batting and we need to improve quickly"

Wafi Aziz Satta: "Given Mahmudullah's heroics in this series, coming in every time and digging his team out of trouble, I reckon he should deservedly be the Man of the Series. What a great Birthday gift this has been for me today. Woohoo!"

5.30 pm It wasn't as clear cut as the scorecard might make it seem, but Mahmudullah was the difference again. He just about managed to keep the good balls out, punished the bad ones and secured a famous win. Zimbabwe had kept themselves in the hunt despite posting only 128 with Tendai Chatara and Tinashe Panyangara's probing spells. But the day will be remembered for Taijul Islam, who became the first bowler in ODI history to claim a hat-trick on debut
"We needed it, we deserved it with the consistent cricket we have played," says Mahmudullah, "It's been a boost before the World Cup. We need to work really hard, conditions will be different there"
Riju: "seems like Shakib is going to bag another Man of the Series award. But for me it should go to Mash for his (top order) wickets, one match winning cameo and unorthodox captaincy :)"

commentTextItems.html: slower ball outside off, Mahmudullah has squeezed it away to the cover boundary. Lovely touch
banged in short and that's been called wide for height as the batsman ducks under it

commentPreTextItems.html: Solomon Mire into the attack, with Bangladesh needing eight more

commentTextItems.html: good length ball on middle and leg, kept out
stays deep in his crease to block a flatter ball on off stump

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: rocks back and pulls strongly through midwicket

dropped at short leg! He had to dive forwards and gets his fingertips to the ball. Can't quite hold on from there as Kamungozi gets a little more bounce. Mahmudllah's front foot prod had only resulted in an inside edge. Maruma might have been a bit deep there
fuller delivery on off stump, defended

commentPostTextItems.html: Hassan Arif: "I was hoping Bangladesh would win by 10 wickets. But Bangladesh is winning like bangladesh"

commentTextItems.html: runs down the track and mis-hits to mid-on

oh, that was close! Short midwicket leaped to his left and stuck out a hand, but the slog from Mahmudullah has just enough power behind it to go past him and hit the midwicket boundary. Panyangara was the man
finishes his spell with a good short ball that has Sabbir hopping around. The batsman does quite well though, dropping his wrists and using soft hands to ensure short leg was out of the picture

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: punched down the ground to the long-off boundary. Strong bottom hand powers the shortish ball and it skims away
dug in short and Mahmudullah is happy to let it sail through
back of a length on off stump, defended

goes short and makes him drag it from outside off if he wants to pull. That is exactly what Sabbir does and gets a couple of runs to midiwcket. Barely in control of that though as it skewed up in the air

commentPreTextItems.html: Mohsin: "Just started watching the match...For a moment i thought its a test match in colored clothing..5 slips for Chatara!!" He's finished his 10 overs though. It's Tinashe Panyangara now

commentTextItems.html: shortish and outside off, steered in front of point to pick up a single
stands up tall behind a shortish delivery on middle and punches into the covers

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: goes back to block a shortish delivery outside off
some aggression from Mahmudullah as he swipes at a fuller ball on leg stump and sends it away over wide mid-on. Not perfectly hit, but enough

commentPreTextItems.html: Mazhar: "What kind of pitch is this? one team can not play spin and the other can not play pace. very confusing :)" Nothing wrong with the pitch, that's the respective teams' weaknesses coming out

commentTextItems.html: pushed through on the pads, Sabbir pushes to long-on to raise the hundred

dismissalComment.html: the plan has worked! Sarkar jumps across outside off to try and tickle a short ball towards fine leg and forgets about Sikandar Raza who was lurking close-in. Chatara is overjoyed

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 51 (55b 10x4 0x6 95m) SR: 92.72
Shakib Al Hasan c Masakadza b Panyangara 0 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: caught at first slip on the rebound! But before Shakib walks off, the umpire wants to take a second look at the front foot, which is completely fine. It was full and wide, teasing the batsman to play an extravagant drive. He had not covered the line, it was just his hands going at the ball and the thick edge is pouched rather well by Hami M

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Taylor b Chatara 11 (23b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 47.82

dismissalComment.html: caught down the leg side! It was a fuller ball and slanted down. Mushy goes for the leg glance but seems to have feathered an edge through. It's not quite clear. The umpires double-check on the front foot and it's all fine. Mushy though walked off with a shake of the head and a wry smile

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman not out 13 (16b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: wide delivery outside off and he finds third man, Tamim is gone! It was full and wide outside off, Tamim swished at it without much footwork with a drive and a leading edge flew down to third man for an easy catch

caught at first slip on the rebound! But before Shakib walks off, the umpire wants to take a second look at the front foot, which is completely fine. It was full and wide, teasing the batsman to play an extravagant drive. He had not covered the line, it was just his hands going at the ball and the thick edge is pouched rather well by Hami M

and one of them comes into play! Anamul has been squared up and the edge is safely pouched. Oddly enough the ball was rather wide outside off, but the batsman had got into an awful position. His legs went leg side, his hands pushed at the ball and Masakadza happily converted the chance at first slip
the plan has worked! Sarkar jumps across outside off to try and tickle a short ball towards fine leg and forgets about Sikandar Raza who was lurking close-in. Chatara is overjoyed

caught down the leg side! It was a fuller ball and slanted down. Mushy goes for the leg glance but seems to have feathered an edge through. It's not quite clear. The umpires double-check on the front foot and it's all fine. Mushy though walked off with a shake of the head and a wry smile

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Mire b Panyangara 10 (15b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: wide delivery outside off and he finds third man, Tamim is gone! It was full and wide outside off, Tamim swished at it without much footwork with a drive and a leading edge flew down to third man for an easy catch

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Masakadza b Chatara 8 (13b 2x4 0x6 25m) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: and one of them comes into play! Anamul has been squared up and the edge is safely pouched. Oddly enough the ball was rather wide outside off, but the batsman had got into an awful position. His legs went leg side, his hands pushed at the ball and Masakadza happily converted the chance at first slip

dismissalComment.html: caught at first slip on the rebound! But before Shakib walks off, the umpire wants to take a second look at the front foot, which is completely fine. It was full and wide, teasing the batsman to play an extravagant drive. He had not covered the line, it was just his hands going at the ball and the thick edge is pouched rather well by Hami M

dismissalComment.html: caught down the leg side! It was a fuller ball and slanted down. Mushy goes for the leg glance but seems to have feathered an edge through. It's not quite clear. The umpires double-check on the front foot and it's all fine. Mushy though walked off with a shake of the head and a wry smile

notes: Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 7.6 overs (48 balls), Extras 2
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 42 balls (H Masakadza 40, V Sibanda 14, Ex 1)
H Masakadza: 50 off 48 balls (5 x 4, 3 x 6)
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 19.2 overs (116 balls), Extras 2
Taijul Islam took a hat-trick with the wickets of T Panyangara, J Nyumbu & TL Chatara
Innings Break: Zimbabwe - 128/10 in 30.0 overs (E Chigumbura 3)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 10.1 overs (61 balls), Extras 5
Lunch: Bangladesh - 73/4 in 15.0 overs (Mahmudullah 17, Mushfiqur Rahim 5)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 21.3 overs (130 balls), Extras 16

stories.title: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 5th ODI, Mirpur

stories.title: Mangongo criticises Campbell comments
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Stephen Mangongo, the Zimbabwe coach, has responded to former captain Alistair Campbell's statements, saying that the presence of former cricketers in the set-up had not yielded positive results

image.caption: Solomon Mire struck his second fifty in three matches
image.longCaption: Solomon Mire struck his second fifty in three matches, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.title: 'Just wanted them to play dot balls' - Taijul
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Just wanted them to play dot balls' - Taijul
stories.summary: Bangladesh left-arm spinner Taijul Islam said he was focused on bowling dot balls at the Zimbabwe batsman and had not thought of the hat-trick

image.longCaption: Taijul Islam is mobbed by team-mates after his hat-trick, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur, December 1, 2014

stories.title: Taijul debut hat-trick seals 5-0 win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Taijul Islam debut hat-trick seals 5-0 win
stories.summary: Taijul Islam's hat-trick, the first by an ODI debutant, spun Zimbabwe out for 128 and spurred Bangladesh to their second 5-0 series win

image.caption: Taijul Islam is mobbed by team-mates after his hat-trick
image.longCaption: Taijul Islam is mobbed by team-mates after his hat-trick, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur, December 1, 2014

stories.title: Mashrafe targets another whitewash
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza said Bangladesh's preparation has given him the confidence to look forward to sealing another whitewash over Zimbabwe

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza is elated with the wicket of Elton Chigumbura
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza is elated with the wicket of Elton Chigumbura, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.title: Masakadza hails Mire, Kamungozi
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Zimbabwe have had a difficult tour of Bangladesh, but the performances of Solomon Mire and Tafadzwa Kamungozi have caught the eye of the senior players including Hamilton Masakadza

image.caption: Hamilton Masakadza watches the ball go through the off side
image.longCaption: Hamilton Masakadza watches the ball go through the off side, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.title: Bangladesh eye perfect end to series
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Dhaka
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh eye perfect end to series
stories.summary: With nothing except pride and records to play for, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe will both be looking to make more use of their reserves for the final ODI
